title: Hearts vs Hibs blackout: Jambos hero Stephane Adam in plea to watch Edinburgh derby as Uefa rules ban TV

organizations.name: ibrox mcghee's don mad watch motherwell

text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments HEARTS legend Stephane Adam has appealed to fellow Jambos for a way to watch their side take on Hibs in the Scottish Cup replay – and beat the TV blackout that has left fans fuming. 
The Edinburgh derby won’t be shown on TV due to strict Uefa rules which prevent domestic games being aired at the same time as Champions League fixtures. News Group Newspapers Ltd 2 Stephane Adam has asked fans at stadium for way to watch game 
And Hearts’ Scottish Cup winning hero, who scored in their historic win against Rangers in 1998, is one of thousands of frustrated supporters who will be left in the dark on Wednesday come kick off. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news, gossip and rumours 
The 47-year-old, who now lives in his native France, took to social media earlier this week to ask: “Anyone know if the Hearts v Hibs replay is show on streaming.” 
He was quickly inundated with pledges from fans who plan to broadcast the game live on their mobile phones using social media app Periscope and other feeds. 
Supporters from as far away as Thailand have also taken to fan forums to find a way to use technology to get around the blackout. Barney, from Atlanta, US, posted on the Hibees Bounce forum: “I know the game is not on conventional channels due to this farcical Uefa shambles. 
“However is the game being shown out with Europe on some of these dodgy channels? 
“Desperately trying to find a link to watch.” 
One member replied: “Try Periscope lads, it’s not too bad to be fair, I’m sure there will be loads of fans live streaming it.” 
The fifth-round clash between the two capital clubs earlier this month ended in a dull 0-0 draw at Tynecastle forcing a replay.
